column2:
COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country require.
From 16 March 2022 no COVID-19 documentation is required to enter Moldova.
column3:
Self-isolation at own accommodation- if not in possession of pre-requisite documents.
From 16 March 2022 no COVID-19 documentation is required to enter Moldova.
column4: You will be exempt from self-isolation if you present proof that you have received both doses of an approved vaccination. The second dose must have been administered at least 14 days before your date of arrival. Current rules do not specify whether electronic documents are acceptable as proof, but you are recommended to present your vaccination certificate in paper form.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: All travellers should familiarise themselves with the entry rules for Moldova before travel.
Entering Moldova from Ukraine: All COVID-19 entry requirements are removed, for Moldovans and foreign nationals. Border Police will permit you to cross the Ukrainian-Moldovan checkpoint with a national ID card or a birth certificate.
Entering Moldova from all other countries: From 16 March 2022 no COVID-19 documentation is required to enter Moldova.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Moldova: There are no local travel restrictions in place in Moldova.
Accommodation: Most hotels are open with no restrictive measures in place.
Public places and services: Moldovan authorities have removed most of the COVID-19 related bans. All public spaces, including markets, restaurants, bars, theatres, cinemas are operating as usual, without any limit on the numbers of guests. You should still wear a mask in all closed places, such as public transportation and supermarkets.
No COVID-19 certificate is required in public spaces. Schooling is in-person.
*If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
